title: Phoenix police ID teen killed at house party
content:
One woman is dead and two others are recovering from injuries sustained in an early-morning shooting in Phoenix on Saturday.
According to Phoenix police, the shots were fired during a fight outside of a party at a vacant residence near 4200 West Carter Road at about 1 a.m.
Three people were shot and were transported to the hospital by a personal vehicle, police said.
Kajmere Burton, 18, was later pronounced dead and the two other female victims, aged 17 and 19-years-old, are presently in stable condition.
Police said no arrests have been made yet in connection to the shooting.
Anyone with information about the incident is encouraged to call Phoenix police or Silent Witness at 480-WITNESS.
Tamisha Thompson, Burton's mother, created a GoFundMe on Sat. January 7 to fund the burial of her daughter.
According to the GoFundMe page created by Thompson, Burton did not have life insurance.
(Photo: Garrett Mitchell/The Republic)
